tit.e: Saiguryo (the Office of the High Priestess [of the Ise-jingu Shrine])

sen.j: 斎宮寮（さいぐうりょう）は日本の律令制において伊勢に置かれた令外官。
sen.e: Saiguryo was an extra statutory office established under the ritsuryo penal and administrative system, placed in Ise Province.
Saiguryo was an extra statutory office established under the ritsuryo system, placed in Ise Province.
sen.cmt: penal and administrative を削除しました。
sen.e: Saiguryo was an extra statutory office established under the ritsuryo system, placed in Ise Province.

sen.j: 斎宮寮は伊勢神宮に奉仕していた未婚の皇女斎宮（伊勢斎王）一般の世話を職掌とする。
sen.e: Saiguryo looked after the dairy life of maiden Imperial princesses 'Saigu' or 'Saio' in Ise, who served as priestesses of the Ise Shrine.
Saiguryo looked after the dairy life of maiden Imperial princesses Saigu (Ise Saio), who served as priestesses of the Ise-jingu Shrine.
sen.cmt: maiden Imperial princesses 'Saigu' or 'Saio' in Ise をmaiden Imperial princesses Saigu (Ise Saio) に修正しました。Ise を Ise-jingu に修正しました。
sen.e: Saiguryo looked after the dairy life of maiden Imperial princesses Saigu (Ise Saio), who served as priestesses of the Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 斎宮寮の役所は伊勢国多気郡に置かれ斎宮はその内院で暮らした。
sen.e: Saigu lived in the inner area of the Saiguryo office, which was placed in Taki county in Ise province.
Saigu lived in the innermost house of the Saiguryo office, which was placed in Taki County in Ise Province.
sen.cmt: inner area を innermost house に修正しました。Taki county in Ise province を Taki County in Ise Province に修正しました。
sen.e: Saigu lived in the innermost house of the Saiguryo office, which was placed in Taki County in Ise Province.

sen.j: 斎宮が不便をしないよう､京都の朝廷を模した長官の頭以下120名以上に及ぶ大規模な官司で配下にある十三の役所が出納・清掃・医療などの事務を分掌した。
sen.e: For convenience of Saigu, Saiguryo took after the Imperial Court in Kyoto with a large organization of more than 120 officials including the head--its subordinate thirteen offices shared the duties including secretariat, cleaning, and medical care.

For convenience of Saigu, Saiguryo took after the Imperial Court in Kyoto with a large organization of more than 120 officials including the head and its subordinate thirteen offices shared the duties including secretariat, cleaning, and medical care.

sen.e: For convenience of Saigu, Saiguryo took after the Imperial Court in Kyoto with a large organization of more than 120 officials including the head and its subordinate thirteen offices shared the duties including secretariat, cleaning, and medical care.

sen.j: 斎宮寮は三つも区域に分かれ､最奥部の内院に斎宮が､中院に頭以下の幹部が､そして外院に下級職員が暮らし､そして事務を行っていた。
sen.e: Saiguryo was divided into three areas: The innermost area was Saigu's residence; The middle area was the residence of the head and other leading members; and The outer area was the residence and working place of the low-level officials.

sen.cmt: The を the に修正しました。Low-level を lower-level に修正しました。
sen.e: Saiguryo was divided into three areas: the innermost area was Saigu's residence; the middle area was the residence of the head and other leading members; and the outer area was the residence and working place of the lower-level officials.

sen.j: 寮跡は斎宮跡として国の史跡に指定されている。
sen.e: The remains of the Saiguryo is designated a National Historic Site.

sen.e: Although the established period of the organization relating to Saigu has not been determined, it is recognized that the predecessor of Saiguryo existed as an extra statutory office when the Taiho Ritsuryo codes were enforced.
